article.description:
Collis Temple scored 18 points to lead LSU to
an 85-56 victory over Arkansas in the first round of the
Southeastern Conference tournament on Thursday.
article.headline: LSU coasts to sixth straight victory
article.linkText: LSU hands Arkansas worst loss of the season
article.story: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. (AP) -- Jonathon Modica poured in 25 points to lead Arkansas to an 84-77 exhibition victory Saturday over NW Sport Tours. Modica finished 9-for-13 from the field, including 2-of-4 from 3-point range, and hit 5 of his 6 free throws. Three other Razorbacks added 10 points apiece -- Billy Pharis, who hit 3 of his 4 shots from long distance; Ronnie Brewer; and Eric Ferguson. Vincent Hunter had 9 points, but grabbed 10 rebounds. Arkansas led 45-33 at the half. Darius Beard topped NW Sport's scoring with 17 points, while Eric Franson added 15.
